title: Abrego Garcia Detained Again After Administration Signaled It Would Re-Deport Him
summary: The move came three days after Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia was freed from custody in the criminal case that was filed against him in Federal District Court in Nashville.

title: Trump Signs Orders Aiming to End Cashless Bail
summary: The president has long railed against cashless bail, but studies have not backed up his claims that changes in bail laws lead to an increase in crime.

title: FEMA Employees Warn That Trump Is Gutting Disaster Response
summary: After Hurricane Katrina, Congress passed a law to strengthen the nation’s disaster response. FEMA employees say the Trump administration has reversed that progress.

title: Trump Relies on Personal Diplomacy With Putin. The Result Is a Strategic Muddle.
summary: For President Trump, consistency is less important than leader-to-leader diplomacy.

title: What’s Next for Ukraine After All That Diplomacy?
summary: After President Trump held talks with President Vladimir V. Putin, he said the Russian leader would be willing to meet with Ukraine’s president. That seems less and less likely.

title: How China Influences Elections in America’s Biggest City
summary: The Chinese Consulate in Manhattan has mobilized community groups to defeat candidates who don’t fall in line with the authoritarian state.

title: 中共如何影响纽约的各级选举
summary: 同乡会等团体已成为中国驻纽约领事馆干预纽约各级选举的工具。这些组织大力扶持那些持亲中共立场的候选人、阻挠那些反对北京的政治人物。

title: Red Envelopes With Cash Are Changing Hands at Adams Campaign Rallies
summary: New York Times reporters witnessed supporters of Mayor Eric Adams handing out cash-filled envelopes. Sometimes, that money went to reporters from Chinese-language outlets.

title: Five Journalists Among Those Killed in Israeli Strikes on Gaza Hospital
summary: The five Gaza-based reporters had worked for various international media outlets, their employers said. The Israeli military confirmed its forces had struck the hospital area, without saying why.

summary: Five journalists were killed in what local officials said was an Israeli strike on Nasser Hospital in the southern Gazan city of Khan Younis.

title: E1 Settlement in West Bank Tied to Greater Israel Goal
summary: Israel’s approval of a settlement project delayed for decades shows how far Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has gone in dashing Palestinian aspirations.

title: How Did Jillian Michaels End Up Here?
summary: America’s toughest trainer was a proud Hollywood liberal. Now, she’s become a defining voice of the MAHA era.

title: With Trump’s Takeover, Washington Finds a Mission to Resist
summary: Known more for their museums, monuments and government buildings than their culture, Washingtonians are showing a spirit of dissent as protesters dog federal agents in their streets.

title: National Guard Patrols Begin to Carry Weapons in D.C.
summary: More than 2,200 troops were deployed in Washington as of Sunday, a Guard spokesman said.

title: As Housing Demand Continues to Fall, Builders Get Creative
summary: A slow start to the home building market this year has prompted some builders to increase incentives and build on smaller lots.

title: The Real Reason Americans Worry About Trade
summary: Behind the pushback to global trade is a deep economic anxiety that a meager social safety net has caused in the United States.

title: Can Robots Be a Good Thing? Factories Rent Them to Retain Human Workers
summary: Robots-for-rent is one way some small U.S. factories gain access to automation, reducing turnover and ensuring workers aren’t injured.

title: Katherine LaNasa Earned Her Role in ‘The Pitt’ the Hard Way
summary: The actress received an Emmy nod for her performance as a seasoned E.R. nurse, a woman who has seen it all and lived to keep fighting. So has LaNasa.

title: New Study Shows Heat Waves Make People Age Faster
summary: Exposure to heat waves over just two years could add up to 12 extra days of age-related health damage.

title: What Does It Take to Get Men to See a Doctor?
summary: Men in the U.S. live around five years fewer than women. One clinic is trying to persuade men that getting checked out could save their life.

title: In Ohio, a Solar Co-Op Helps Families Go Solar for Less
summary: A group of homeowners worked together to navigate the process of installing rooftop solar systems, saving time and money in the process.

title: Maurice Tempelsman, Diamond Magnate and Jackie Onassis’s Companion, Dies at 95
summary: A private and politically connected gem merchant, he was thrust into the public spotlight when his personal relationship with the former first lady became known in the late 1980s.

title: Cases Closed
summary: We explore how President Trump selectively enforces the law.

title: Scientists Perform First Pig-to-Human Lung Transplant
summary: Researchers in China placed a lung from a genetically modified pig into a brain-dead man, with mixed results.

title: Mamdani’s Voters Want Free Child Care. Here’s How He Could Do It.
summary: Zohran Mamdani’s coalition in the New York mayor’s race includes residents who have questioned whether they can afford to raise children in the city.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI Sues Apple Over Claims It Favors OpenAI
summary: Mr. Musk’s artificial intelligence company, xAI, claimed that its Grok chatbot app was being artificially suppressed in Apple’s App Store.

title: The Typical American College Student Is Not Who You Think
summary: As a fight over the future of elite higher education consumes university leaders and politicians, most college students live in a very different world with very different challenges.
